Despatches from United States Consuls in St Paul Loanda

div1.p: I have the honor to enclose translation of a despatch received from His Excellency the Governor General in reply to a despatch I wrote him, with reference to the American Mission lately expelled from Bailunda & Bihé. Since that date Mr Walters, Chief of the Mission has been here and I presented him personally to His Excellency the Governor, & the Governor has promised to do all in his power to assist the Mission and has given Mr Walters a document with the private seal of the Government attached, to the chiefs of Bailunda & Bihé requesting them to do all in their power to assist the Mission and informing the said chiefs that any persons presenting themselves for the future as representing the Government, must present a similar seal before they are to be recognised as such. Mr Walters has returned to Benguella and seems to think he will not have much trouble for the future. Mr Saunders another member of the Mission has returned to Bailunda and they appear to have great hopes of recovering the greater part of their property.
